title: Sporadic Creutzfeldt Jakob disease presenting with cerebral atrophy following traumatic brain injury mimicking hydrocephalus a case report and literature review
summary: This paper presents a rare case of sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD) in a patient who initially presented with cerebral ventricle dilation mimicking hydrocephalus following a traumatic brain injury (TBI). The study highlights the diagnostic challenges and the importance of advanced neurological investigations, including CSF biomarkers, MRI, and EEG, to accurately diagnose sCJD in complex clinical scenarios.

title: Jordan-Segmentable Masks: A Topology-Aware definition for characterizing Binary Image Segmentation
summary: This paper introduces the concept of a 'Jordan-segmentable mask,' a topology-aware definition for binary image segmentation evaluation. It proposes a mathematically rigorous, unsupervised criterion based on the Jordan Curve Theorem, digital topology, and homology theory to assess whether a segmentation correctly partitions an image into two topologically separate, connected regions. This addresses limitations of conventional metrics that often fail to capture structural coherence and connectivity crucial for accurate object delineation.

title: Representation-Aware Unlearning via Activation Signatures: From Suppression to Knowledge-Signature Erasure
summary: This paper introduces the Knowledge Immunization Framework (KIF), a representation-aware unlearning method for LLMs that targets internal activation signatures to achieve true knowledge erasure, differentiating it from mere behavioral suppression. KIF successfully breaks the stability-erasure tradeoff seen in prior work, demonstrating near-oracle erasure (FQ ~0.99) while preserving model utility (MU = 0.62) across various LLMs from 3B to 14B parameters. The framework provides the first systematic diagnosis of mechanism-level forgetting behavior.

title: causalfe: Causal Forests with Fixed Effects in Python
summary: The causalfe package introduces a Python implementation of Causal Forests with Fixed Effects (CFFE) to accurately estimate heterogeneous treatment effects in panel data settings. This method addresses the challenge of unit and time fixed effects, which typically induce spurious heterogeneity in standard causal forest estimates, by performing node-level residualization during tree construction. Through simulation studies, the package demonstrates validated performance, offering a robust tool for causal inference in longitudinal settings relevant to precision medicine and health research.

title: Breaking Up with Normatively Monolithic Agency with GRACE: A Reason-Based Neuro-Symbolic Architecture for Safe and Ethical AI Alignment
summary: This paper introduces GRACE (Governor for Reason-Aligned ContainmEnt), a novel neuro-symbolic reason-based containment architecture designed to ensure ethical alignment of autonomous AI agents. It decouples normative reasoning from instrumental decision-making, allowing for the integration and control of diverse AI systems to ensure their actions are not only effective but also morally permissible, interpretable, and justifiable.

title: ErrEval: Error-Aware Evaluation for Question Generation through Explicit Diagnostics
summary: This paper introduces ErrEval, an Error-aware Evaluation framework designed to improve automatic Question Generation (QG) evaluation by explicitly identifying and diagnosing critical defects like factual hallucinations and answer mismatches. ErrEval employs a two-stage process involving an Error Identifier and informed LLM evaluators, demonstrating enhanced alignment with human judgments and effectively mitigating the overestimation of low-quality questions.
